verses.verse: Be imitators <WG3402> of me, just <WG2531> as I also <WG2532> am of Christ. <WG5547>

Now <WG1161> I praise <WG1867> you because <WG3754> you remember <WG3403> me in everything, <WG3956> and hold <WG2722> firmly <WG2722> to the traditions, <WG3862> just <WG2531> as I delivered <WG3860> them to you.

But I want <WG2309> you to understand <WG3609> that Christ <WG5547> is the head <WG2776> of every <WG3956> man, <WG435> and the man <WG435> is the head <WG2776> of a woman, <WG1135> and God <WG2316> is the head <WG2776> of Christ. <WG5547>
Every <WG3956> man <WG435> who has <WG2192> [something] on his head <WG2776> while praying <WG4336> or <WG2228> prophesying, <WG4395> disgraces <WG2617> his head. <WG2776>

But every <WG3956> woman <WG1135> who has her head <WG2776> uncovered <WG177> while praying <WG4336> or <WG2228> prophesying, <WG4395> disgraces <WG2617> her head; <WG2776> for she is one <WG1520> and the same <WG846> with her whose head is shaved. <WG3587>

For if <WG1487> a woman <WG1135> does not cover <WG2619> her head, let her also <WG2532> have her hair <WG2751> cut <WG2751> off; <WG2751> but if <WG1487> it is disgraceful <WG150> for a woman <WG1135> to have her hair <WG2751> cut <WG2751> off <WG2751> or <WG2228> her head shaved, <WG3587> let her cover <WG2619> her head.

For a man <WG435> ought <WG3784> not to have his head <WG2776> covered, <WG2619> since he is the image <WG1504> and glory <WG1391> of God; <WG2316> but the woman <WG1135> is the glory <WG1391> of man. <WG435>
For man <WG435> does not originate <WG1510> from woman, <WG1135> but woman <WG1135> from man; <WG435>
for indeed <WG2532> man <WG435> was not created <WG2936> for the woman <WG1135>'s sake, <WG1223> but woman for the man's sake. <WG1223>
Therefore <WG1223> <WG3778> the woman <WG1135> ought <WG3784> to have <WG2192> [a symbol of] authority <WG1849> on her head, <WG2776> because <WG1223> of the angels. <WG32>
However, <WG4133> in the Lord, <WG2962> neither <WG3777> is woman <WG1135> independent <WG5565> of man, <WG435> nor <WG3777> is man <WG435> independent <WG5565> of woman. <WG1135>

For as the woman <WG1135> originates from the man, <WG435> so <WG3779> also <WG2532> the man <WG435> [has his birth] through <WG1223> the woman; <WG1135> and all <WG3956> things <WG3956> originate from God. <WG2316>
Judge <WG2919> for yourselves <WG4771>: <WG846> is it proper <WG4241> for a woman <WG1135> to pray <WG4336> to God <WG2316> [with head] uncovered <WG177>?
Does not even <WG3761> nature <WG5449> itself <WG846> teach <WG1321> you that if <WG1437> a man <WG435> has <WG2863> long <WG2863> hair, <WG2863> it is a dishonor <WG819> to him,
but if <WG1437> a woman <WG1135> has <WG2863> long <WG2863> hair, <WG2863> it is a glory <WG1391> to her? For her hair <WG2864> is given <WG1325> to her for a covering. <WG4018>
But if <WG1487> one <WG5100> is inclined <WG1380> to be contentious, <WG5380> we have <WG2192> no <WG3756> other <WG5108> practice, <WG4914> nor <WG3761> have the churches <WG1577> of God. <WG2316>
But in giving <WG3853> this <WG3778> instruction, <WG3853> I do not praise <WG1867> you, because <WG3754> you come <WG4905> together <WG4905> not for the better <WG2909> but for the worse. <WG7090>

For, in the first <WG4413> place, when you come <WG4905> together <WG4905> as a church, <WG1577> I hear <WG191> that divisions <WG4978> exist <WG5225> among <WG1722> you; and in part, <WG3313> I believe <WG4100> it.

For there must <WG1163> also <WG2532> be factions <WG139> among <WG1722> you, in order <WG2443> that those <WG3588> who are approved <WG1384> may have become <WG1096> evident <WG5318> among <WG1722> you.
Therefore <WG3767> when you meet <WG4905> together <WG1909>, <WG3588> <WG846> it is not to eat <WG2068> the Lord's Supper, <WG1173>

for in your eating <WG2068> each <WG1538> one <WG1538> takes <WG4301> his own <WG2398> supper <WG1173> first; <WG4301> and one <WG3739> <WG3303> is hungry <WG3983> and another <WG3739> <WG1161> is drunk. <WG3184>

What! <WG1063> Do you not have <WG2192> houses <WG3614> in which to eat <WG2068> and drink <WG4095>? Or <WG2228> do you despise <WG2706> the church <WG1577> of God, <WG2316> and shame <WG2617> those <WG3588> who have <WG2192> nothing <WG3361>? What <WG5101> shall I say <WG3004> to you? Shall I praise <WG1867> you? In this <WG3778> I will not praise <WG1867> you.

For I received <WG3880> from the Lord <WG2962> that which <WG3739> I also <WG2532> delivered <WG3860> to you, that the Lord <WG2962> Jesus <WG2424> in the night <WG3571> in which <WG3739> He was betrayed <WG3860> took <WG2983> bread; <WG740>
and when He had given <WG2168> thanks, <WG2168> He broke <WG2806> it, and said, <WG3004> "This <WG3778> is My body, <WG4983> which is for you; do <WG4160> this <WG3778> in remembrance <WG364> of Me."

In the same <WG5615> way <WG5615> [He took] the cup <WG4221> also, <WG2532> after <WG3326> supper, <WG1172> saying, <WG3004> "This <WG3778> cup <WG4221> is the new <WG2537> covenant <WG1242> in My blood; <WG129> do <WG4160> this, <WG3778> as often <WG3740> as you drink <WG4095> [it,] in remembrance <WG364> of Me."
For as often <WG3740> as you eat <WG2068> this <WG3778> bread <WG740> and drink <WG4095> the cup, <WG4221> you proclaim <WG2605> the Lord's death <WG2288> until <WG891> He comes. <WG2064>

Therefore <WG5620> whoever <WG3739> <WG302> eats <WG2068> the bread <WG740> or <WG2228> drinks <WG4095> the cup <WG4221> of the Lord <WG2962> in an unworthy <WG371> manner, <WG371> shall be guilty <WG1777> of the body <WG4983> and the blood <WG129> of the Lord. <WG2962>
But let a man <WG444> examine <WG1381> himself, <WG1438> and so <WG3779> let him eat <WG2068> of the bread <WG740> and drink <WG4095> of the cup. <WG4221>
For he who eats <WG2068> and drinks, <WG4095> eats <WG2068> and drinks <WG4095> judgment <WG2917> to himself, <WG1438> if he does not judge <WG1252> the body <WG4983> rightly.
For this <WG3778> reason <WG1223> many <WG4183> among <WG1722> you are weak <WG772> and sick, <WG732> and a number <WG2425> sleep. <WG2837>
But if <WG1487> we judged <WG1252> ourselves <WG1438> rightly, we should not be judged. <WG2919>
But when we are judged, <WG2919> we are disciplined <WG3811> by the Lord <WG2962> in order <WG2443> that we may not be condemned <WG2632> along <WG4862> with the world. <WG2889>
So <WG5620> then, <WG5620> my brethren, <WG80> when you come <WG4905> together <WG4905> to eat, <WG2068> wait <WG1551> for one <WG240> another. <WG240>

If <WG1487> anyone <WG5100> is hungry, <WG3983> let him eat <WG2068> at home, <WG3624> so <WG2443> that you may not come <WG4905> together <WG4905> for judgment. <WG2917> And the remaining <WG3062> matters I shall arrange <WG1299> when <WG5613> I come. <WG2064>
